shapes.zeroItemText: You don't know any shapes yet, and aren't eligible to learn any!

shape.name: Projectile
shape.desc: You are able to focus your will into a concentrated ball, which you can propel forwards away from you. The projectile will last for 5 seconds of flight, or until it strikes something. It will by default pass through water and non-collidable blocks unless you modify it with target non-solid blocks.

shape.name: Channeled
shape.desc: Through intense concentration, a mage can maintain a flow of magic on themselves. This is useful for things like Telekinesis, Healing, Attract, and Storm.

shape.name: Beam
shape.desc: It isn't much of a mental shift to switch from a channeled spell to a beam. The amount of strain, however, is another story. A beam is a much more controlled version of a channeled spell.

shape.name: Self
shape.desc: One of the simplest forms of magic application is applying the magic to yourself. The distance is low, and the target is willing. You only hope you don't accidentally light yourself on fire.

shape.name: Touch
shape.desc: Simply wrap your hand in magic, and reach out. Touch is a very short range shape; it does not follow the block highlighting. You need to be almost bumping into a block for touch to apply its effect.

shape.name: Zone
shape.desc: You have learned to focus your will into an area effect that will persist for a time.

shape.name: AoE
shape.desc: After charging your spell, you can shape it into a blast that radiates outwards from the spell's origin. If gravity is applied, AoE will search downwards for blocks to apply to. This is useful for lowering a hill without changing its natural shape, and many other things. An AoE spell will not affect the caster.

shape.name: Chain
shape.desc: You can shape your magic into a blast that jumps from one target to the next. Chain by default contains an 8-block built in touch-like component (with an extended range - 8 blocks or so), so there is no need to add additional stages; though you can if you like, projectile for example to start the chain somewhere else. A chain spell cannot affect the caster. Chain jump range can be extended by using the #5Range#0 modifier, and the number of jumps can be increased by using #5Procs#0

shape.name: Rune
shape.desc: You can create a magically-infused rune on the ground that when triggered can apply powerful buffs...or deadly traps.

shape.name: Contingency: Fall
shape.desc: You have figured out a spell shape that triggers when falling the instant before you hit the ground. !d Oh gravity, thou art a heartless... !d You can only have one contingency active at a time.

shape.name: Contingency: Damage
shape.desc: You have managed to create a spell that triggers only when you get hurt. !d Let's play shot for shot. !d You can only have one contingency active at a time.

shape.name: Contingency: Fire
shape.desc: You've decided you really don't like being on fire anymore. To that end, you made a spell that will light up when the flames do. !d You can only have one contingency active at a time.

shape.name: Contingency: Health
shape.desc: No matter how subtle the wizard, a knife between the shoulder blades will seriously cramp his style. You think you have found a way to make them regret trying that. Or need two knives. !d This contingency procs when your health is less than or equal to 25% of maximum. !d You can only have one contingency active at a time.

shape.name: Contingency: Death
shape.desc: You may get me, but in those few seconds it takes you, I will have all the time I need to ensure you come along for the ride. !d You can only have one contingency active at a time.

shape.name: Binding
shape.desc: You can create solid objects out of nothing! The binding shape allows you to bind tools to yourself, which drain constant mana while bound, and burst mana when used instead of durability. Dropping the item with the drop hotkey (default 'q') will instead unbind it.

shape.name: Wall
shape.desc: You can manifest a wall in front of you. The wall will run perpendicular to your current direction. Walls function similarly to zones, but with a different form factor. Walls also apply their effects more rapidly.

shape.name: Wave
shape.desc: Project a wave of magic in front of you that rolls forward, applying its effect to everything in its path.

components.zeroItemText: You don't know any components yet, and aren't eligible to learn any!

component.name: Force Damage
component.desc: Often a young mage will begin his training with simple physical force. More often he will continue that training by smacking his colleagues in the back of the head with more physical force. Force is a physical damage type, and does not pierce armor.

component.name: Magic Damage
component.desc: Magical damage differs from physical damage in that it bypasses many kinds of armors and attacks the target's aura directly - which can be just as devastating, if not more. This makes summoned and charmed creatures especially vulnerable, making them take triple damage.

component.name: Frost Damage
component.desc: Many underestimate the power that frost can wield. The creeping chill can bypass many armors, and frost is devstating against the denizens of the nether. Frost damage also applies a brief slowing effect when it hits.

component.name: Lightning Damage
component.desc: I held my hands in front of me, and with a sharp crack a bolt of brilliant white lightning forked across the sky. His metal armor acted as a lightning rod, drawing each bolt down into him. Lightning does an exceptional amount of damage, but carries a hefty mana cost.

component.name: Fire Damage
component.desc: With a word, I released my will and fire erupted from out in front of me, searing everything in its path. Fire damage is hard hitting, but many nether mobs are immune to its effects.

component.name: Ignition
component.desc: Many magi see fire as a damaging, destructive force, and that can be true. But how many hear fire and imagine lighting a stove, campfire or candle?

component.name: Forge
component.desc: You have gained fine control over fire and can use it to magically smelt blocks where they stand, without charring them to ash.

component.name: Blind
component.desc: Having a fireball to throw at dark mages is great. Making it so they also can't see to retaliate is better.

component.name: Freeze
component.desc: Eira breathed deeply and opened her eyes. The caps of the mountains now glistened white with snow and a sublime frost covered everything. Water had become ice. Enemies moved at a crawl. Perfect.

component.name: Knockback
component.desc: Not many mages want to be in melee range. This allows that situation to be corrected.

component.name: Thunderstorm
component.desc: The clouds darkened, and rain began to fall. The wind howled, and a flash of lightning streaked across the sky, leaving bright flashes in my vision. The thunder was deafening. Lightning struck all around me at each enemy. The strain of maintaining the storm was immense.

component.name: Astral Distortion
component.desc: As I tried to step into the void, the warp shimmered and seemed to solidify. I walked face first into it, much to the amusement of my students. This effect seemed to prevent my teleportation abilities entirely. I had to turn this against Endermen as well.

component.name: Fling
component.desc: Wind whirled around under the creeper and suddenly all at once blew straight up, sending it skyward.

component.name: Watery Grave
component.desc: The water seemed to come alive, wrapping tendrils around the light mage and dragging him down into the black, crushing depths. His friend on the shore could only watch helplessly, for to jump into the water would mean the same fate for him.

component.name: Leap
component.desc: Gathering wind around me, I propelled myself into the air. I held the wind close through the jump, releasing it in an upward burst just as I landed, protecting me from the fall.

component.name: Regeneration
component.desc: I wrapped my arm in a healing light, and watched as every injury, down to the last bruise, slowly vanished before my eyes.

component.name: Slowfall
component.desc: Become light as a feather, and fall without fear.

component.name: Life Tap
component.desc: If a mage is desparate and mana is scarce, he can fuel his spells using his own life force.

component.name: Heal
component.desc: By greatly increasing the amount of power put into regenerative effects, a mage can knit almost any injury back together. The effect is taxing, however.

component.name: Slow
component.desc: By applying the equivalent of a magical ball and chain, a mage can greatly slow the movements of his target.

component.name: Haste
component.desc: Wrapping the target's legs in arcane energy, a mage can greatly increase movement speed.

component.name: Gravity Well
component.desc: You have learned to create a localized gravity well under your target, greatly increasing the speed at which they fall.

component.name: Life Drain
component.desc: By creating a sinister link with the target's life force, you can siphon it off into your own, bolstering your own health.

component.name: Dispel
component.desc: Creating a localized field of deficit, you can remove a number of effects on your target. Dispel also wreaks havoc on summoned creatures, banishing them back into the ether.

component.name: Repel
component.desc: You can create a singularity in space, which, as long as you maintain it, will radiate waves of force, pushing enemies and deflecting arrows away from you.

component.name: Swift Swim
component.desc: By manipulating water currents, you can propel yourself along much more quickly underwater.

component.name: Levitation
component.desc: Through practicing air magic, you can now hold yourself suspended in midair. With small wind currents, you can move slowly about while floating.

component.name: Mana Drain
component.desc: You can create a parasitic bond with the target's aura, draining their mana and boosting your own.

component.name: Entangle
component.desc: At your command, vines can burst from the ground and ensnare your target, holding them completely immobile.

component.name: Flight
component.desc: With a word, I rose into the air and mingled with the clouds and sky. I flew effortlessly, quick and agile. The skies were mine alone.

component.name: Shield
component.desc: You can summon arcane energy to shield yourself. This shield will reduce all damage taken. This cannot be active at the same time as reflect.

component.name: Reflect
component.desc: You can change the makeup of your shield so that spells will bounce off instead of reducing physical damage. This cannot be active at the same time as shield.

component.name: Chrono Anchor
component.desc: You can anchor yourself in time. When the timer runs out, you are transported back to the place you cast this spell, with your health, mana, burnout, and hunger returning to what they were when the spell was first cast.

component.name: Charm
component.desc: You can charm creatures into fighting for you, and certain creatures will do special things when charmed. Charming also causes creatures to breed (if they are capable of doing so by other means).

component.name: Dig
component.desc: The ground shatters with a snap of your fingers. Harder blocks take more mana to break. Dig starts out equivalent to an Iron pickaxe, but can be upgraded with the use of the #5Mining Power#0 modifier.

component.name: Light
component.desc: You can light up an area with magic. Lights can be recolored after the fact by right clicking them with a dye. Forge Ore Dictionary is supported for valid Dyes.

component.name: Disarm
component.desc: Now that you have learned to summon tools to your hand, it was a small step to be able to make others drop what they are holding.

component.name: Rift Storage
component.desc: You can tear open a rift in space, granting access to a small dimension to store items in. The rift lasts for 60 seconds before closing automatically. More Buff Power modifiers give greater storage access. Sneak+Right click to close the rift once it is opened.

component.name: Attract
component.desc: You create an area of negative pressure around you, pulling everything living in towards you.

component.name: Telekinesis
component.desc: You can use your magic to amplify your brainwaves, giving them physical form. These waves can be used to pull items and XP towards a point in front of you. Rolling the mouse wheel while using the spell can change the distance of the point closer or farther away from you.

component.name: Harvest
component.desc: You can cause all plants, leaves, and flowers to be harvested.

component.name: Plow
component.desc: You can cause the earth to churn at your command, creating deep furrows ideal for planting.

component.name: Create Water
component.desc: You can coalesce moisture from the air around into one location, creating water where there was none. This will not work in the nether. It can also be used to fill a cauldron.

component.name: Grow
component.desc: Pouring energy into plants, equal to months of talking to them, will cause them to grow more rapidly.

component.name: Banish Rain
component.desc: Rain rain, go away. Come again another day! Who would have thought that those were the words to the spell? If used in the corresponding ritual, this spell can also call rain too. See the #5Rituals#0 page for details.

component.name: Water Breathing
component.desc: You can use your magic to pull oxygen from the water, allowing you to get enough to not drown.

component.name: Night Vision
component.desc: Your knowledge of light has allowed you to devise a spell that will let you amplify light levels, effectively letting you see in the dark.

component.name: True Sight
component.desc: Your magical sight allows you to see things as they really are. Who knows what beauties...and horrors you will discover.

component.name: Invisibility
component.desc: You can bend light around yourself to become effectively invisible.

component.name: Random Teleport
component.desc: You can randomly teleport your target a short distance away.

component.name: Blink
component.desc: You can teleport a short distance directly forward the way you are facing. Blink can take you through solid walls, but will make every effort to ensure you don't get stuck in one.

component.name: Transplace
component.desc: Your knowledge of teleportation magic has grown. You can now switch places with your target.

component.name: Mark
component.desc: You can magically mark a location, which you can recall to from almost anywhere.

component.name: Recall
component.desc: You can tune your teleportation magic to home in on a mark you have left, transporting you or your target back to its location.

component.name: Ender Intervention
component.desc: You have mastered teleportation magic, to the level at which you can transcend interdimensional barriers, and can enter the nether from almost anywhere.

component.name: Divine Intervention
component.desc: You have mastered teleportation magic, to the level at which you can transcend interdimensional barriers, and can enter the overworld from almost anywhere. If cast when you are already in the overworld, you will be returned to your bed, or to spawn if no bed exists.

component.name: Summon
component.desc: You have learned to harvest the souls of creatures you defeat in combat. These souls can be used in creating a spell to summon that creature to protect you. !d To summon a creature, first craft a #5Crystal Phylactery#0. Once you kill something while holding an empty phylactery, that phylactery will become #9attuned#0 to that specific mob. Kill enough of the same mob and you will fill the phylactery. !d During spell creation, you can throw in any filled phylactery when prompted by the lectern. This step is what determines what your spell will summon. !d Summoned creatures drop no loot, and no xp, but can be interacted with normally, such as breeding, milking cows, or riding horses. Horses are the exception to the item drop rule and will drop saddles and armor given to them. !l Tameable creatures such as wolves and cats are automatically tamed to their owner upon summoning. !d Bosses cannot be trapped in phylacteries in survival/adventure mode.

component.name: Blizzard
component.desc: You have learned to summon a fearsome blizzard, which will slow and damage any entities in its radius. Blizzard has a built-in AoE to it. A blizzard cannot be summoned within 5 blocks of another existing blizzard. It initially does less damage than other attacks, but scales more quickly with modifiers. It also has the unique capability to deal damage more often than regular attacks. Though blizzard will harm all entities in its radius, it will never harm its caster.

component.name: Daylight
component.desc: You have gained the ability to control time. This spell will cause the time to move to Dawn.

component.name: Starstrike
component.desc: You can call down a star from the skies and cause it to strike all entities within the blast radius. It will harm friendly targets but not the caster. There is a short delay between casting the spell and the impact. This spell will not work underground (the star will fall onto the surface).

component.name: Firestorm
component.desc: You have learned to summon a terrible firestorm, which will do large amounts of damage any entities in its radius. Firestorm has a built-in AoE to it. A firestorm cannot be summoned within 5 blocks of another existing firestorm. It initially does less damage than other attacks, but scales more quickly with modifiers. It also has the unique capability to deal damage more often than regular attacks. Firestorm does not ignite the ground. Though firestorm will harm all entities in its radius, it will never harm its caster.

component.name: Mana Link
component.desc: You have discovered the secret to linking your mana together with another entity. When you cast this spell, your target will be able to draw upon your mana pool as if it were their own. !d The target will use their own mana first, then will begin to draw upon yours. !d It has a limited radius, but can have radius modifiers if you so desire. If the target leaves the radius, the link is not broken, but is rather temporarily disabled. When they again return into the radius, the link will reactivate and will function again. To end the link, simply cast the spell on the target again. !d You can link your own mana to multiple entities, and on the other side, you can have multiple links coming in from other sources.

component.name: Mana Shield
component.desc: Your target becomes shielded by their available mana, causing damage to drain 250 mana per half heart absorbed, and preventing HP damage entirely.

component.name: Moonrise
component.desc: You have gained the ability to control time. This spell will cause the time to move to Dusk.

component.name: Drought
component.desc: You have taken your knowledge of creating water and have reversed the process. This spell will draw water out of whatever it hits, removing water blocks and turning dirt, grass, sandstone and mycelium to sand, withering plants it hits, and stone to cobblestone.

component.name: Plant
component.desc: You can cause seeds from your inventory to be planted in the ground, if conditions are right for it to grow. Best coupled with AoE or some other such shape for rapid planting.

component.name: Accelerate
component.desc: This spell causes targeted blocks to tick faster. Note that it does not make tile entities any quicker. This spell is best used in a shape like beam, wall, or zone, due to its need to be cast multiple times to have any real effect.

component.name: Drown
component.desc: You can create water directly inside the target's lungs, causing them to take drowning damage.

You have learned to focus your digging magic into a small radius that directly affects leaves. This component has a built in AoE that can be modified with Radius modifiers. You can use it to clear those pesky hard to reach leaves.
component.name: Wizard's Autumn
Fury
component.desc: You can send yourself into an absolute rage, dealing increased damage, moving extremely fast, passively regenerating, and mining at inhuman speeds. When the effect ends, you are left exhausted for a few moments and must recover.

component.name: Appropriation
component.desc: You can appropriate one block or entity into your spell. Casting the spell again will place a picked up entity or block at the targeted location.

component.name: Silence
component.desc: You can silence another entity, preventing all spell casting for a short duration. THe duration cannot be extended.

component.name: Shrink
component.desc: You can make yourself tiny! When this effect is active, you are physically smaller, so you can fit through 1x1 gaps. Due to your light weight, you fall slowly enough that landing doesn't hurt either. However, all damage you do is halved.

component.name: Place Block
component.desc: You can use this spell part to place blocks! Can be extremely powerful when combined with different shape combinations. In order to place a block, you need to set the spell to place it, and you need to have at least one of said block in your inventory. No creating them out of thin air, sorry! To set the block to be placed, cast the spell on a block while sneaking. You need to be sneaking when the spell actually applies, so keep that in mind when using something like Projectile. It's recommended to not use AoE to set the block, as it can sometimes set it to something you don't expect (as it will apply to everything in a radius, setting the block over and over). To see what block the spell will place, hover your mouse over it in your inventory and press SHIFT.

modifiers.zeroItemText: You don't know any modifiers yet, and aren't eligible to learn any!

modifier.name: Gravity
modifier.desc: Amplifies the gravity of certain spell shapes. Zones and projectiles will be affected by gravity. AoE spells will search farther down when applying to terrain for a valid spot to apply (this is useful as it causes it to hug the terrain).

modifier.name: Bounce
modifier.desc: Causes the projectile spell shape to bounce off surfaces.

modifier.name: Damage
modifier.desc: Amplifies the damage dealt by spells.

modifier.name: Healing
modifier.desc: Amplifies the healing done by spells, or the damage dealt by healing spells to the undead.

modifier.name: Speed
modifier.desc: Enhances the speed altering effects of spells, and the speed of projectiles.

modifier.name: Duration
modifier.desc: Enhances the duration of all buff/debuff effects, and increases the duration of zones.

modifier.name: Range
modifier.desc: Increases the range of projectile and beam spells.

modifier.name: Radius
modifier.desc: Increases the radius of zone and AoE spell shapes.

modifier.name: Rune Procs
modifier.desc: Increases the number of times a rune can apply it's effect before being destroyed.

modifier.name: Velocity Added
modifier.desc: Increases the amount of velocity added by spell parts such as #5Fling#0.

modifier.name: Target Non-Solid Blocks
modifier.desc: Allows the spell to target non-solid blocks (grass, water, lava) rather than passing through it.

modifier.name: Lunar
modifier.desc: Powers up your spell at night. The closer to midnight time is (Starting at Dusk), the more damage and healing the spell does. After midnight, as dawn approaches, the spell will become weaker. Range, Duration, and Radius are all increased where applicable based on the phase of the moon (more power approaching full moon). More powerful than Solar due to nights not lasting as long as day.

modifier.name: Solar
modifier.desc: Powers up your spell during the day. The closer to noon time is (Starting at Dawn), the more damage and healing the spell does. After noon, as dusk approaches, the spell will become weaker. Range, Duration, and Radius are all increased where applicable based on the phase of the moon (more power approaching new moon).

modifier.name: Piercing
modifier.desc: Allows the spell to pierce through entities and blocks. 2 pierces are added per modifier, with a maximum of 6.

modifier.name: Mining Power
modifier.desc: You have learned to put more power into your digging spells. This causes them to be able to dig more dense blocks that would require a better pickaxe. Each modifier bumps the spell up by one tool level. The base Dig spell operates at Stone pickaxe mining level.

modifier.name: Prosperity
modifier.desc: Fortune strikes! You can make your digging spells more likely to drop additional ores, and your damaging spells more likely to cause enemies to drop better loot. Each modifier added is equivalent to one level of fortune/looting on the spell.

modifier.name: Buff Power
modifier.desc: You can put more power into your buffs. Each modifier added increases the level of the buff applied. This will not affect duration.

modifier.name: Dismembering
modifier.desc: You've decided that you like souvenirs. So much so, that you have discovered how to make your damaging spells leave some pieces intact. Each modifier adds 5% chance to drop a head when defeating an enemy.

modifier.name: Feather Touch
modifier.desc: With great power comes broken valuables. You've learned to be more careful when casting your digging spells and break things less often. Each modifier is equivalent to one level of Silk Touch on the spell.

talents.zeroItemText: You don't know any talents yet, and aren't eligible to learn any!

talent.name: Affinity Gains Boost
talent.desc: You have decided that elemental attunement is more important than arcane knowledge. You can receive a boost to affinity gains in exchange for slower magic XP gain. This is a permanent effect.

talent.name: Augmented Casting
talent.desc: You have figured out how to put everything you have into a spell cast. All of your spells are more powerful. Durations are longer, radii are bigger, and damage is increased.

talent.name: Extra Summon
talent.desc: Why do things yourself when you can have others do them for you? You can now have one additional summoned/charmed creature or recruited mage (if you have the #5Mage Posse#0 talent)

talent.name: Mage Posse I
talent.desc: Your talents as a mage have impressed others, and your reputation precedes you. You can request that a light mage follow and guard you. This counts against your summon cap.

talent.name: Mage Posse II
talent.desc: You have gained the trust of other mages to the point that they feel safe linking their magic to yours. Whenever you befriend a light mage, they will mana link to you.

talent.name: Mana Regen Boost I
talent.desc: You are more attuned with the energy flowing through you. Your magic regenerates slightly faster than normal.

talent.name: Mana Regen Boost II
talent.desc: You are more attuned with the energy flowing through you. Your magic regenerates faster than normal. This replaces the bonus given by Mana Regen Boost I.

talent.name: Mana Regen Boost III
talent.desc: You are more attuned with the energy flowing through you. Your magic regenerates much faster than normal. This replaces the bonus given by Mana Regen Boost II.

talent.name: Spell Movement
talent.desc: You have realized that agility is key. To that end, you have trained yourself to be able to move at normal speed while using a spell.

talent.name: Colour
talent.desc: This modifier allows you to change the color of the particles on your spell. Want green fireballs? Have at it! Color is determined by the color dye that you throw in during the crafting process. Any one will be accepted, regardless of what the lectern prompts for.

item.name: AM Ores
item.desc: Ars Magica adds a few new ores to the game that you will need to collect and refine.

subitem.name: Vinteum Dust
subitem.desc: Discovered in a small village where a creeper was knocked down a drained well, Vinteum Ore was quickly realized to be a valuable magical powder once cooked inside a furnace.

subitem.name: Arcane Compound
subitem.desc: A combination of materials from multiple worlds, the Arcane Compound forms the base resource needed to get Arcane Ash.

subitem.name: Arcane Ash
subitem.desc: Created by burning #5Arcane Compounds#0 in a furnace, Arcane Ash's Etherium storage capabilities have made it a cornerstone of advanced magical machinery.

subitem.name: Purified Vinteum Dust
subitem.desc: By adding #5Arcane Ash#0 to strengthen its magical properties, and adding #5Blue Orchids#0 as a catalyst and #5Desert Novas#0 to release instability, Vinteum Dust can be put into a purified state with much higher capacity for Etherium.

subitem.name: Chimerite
subitem.desc: Able to shift to all colors and in an ever-changing state, Chimerite is used in spells that require a great deal of alteration or illusion.

subitem.name: Blue Topaz
subitem.desc: A relatively common gem, blue topaz is often used by mages as an entry level crystal to focus Etherium.

subitem.name: Sunstone
subitem.desc: Sunstone is only found in the most intently hot locations in all of Minecraft and worlds beyond. Requiring such intense heat to form, but very low pressure, it is commonly found in the lava lakes of the nether, but can exist in the lava pools of the overworld as well, if you are lucky.

subitem.name: Moonstone
subitem.desc: If one were to look up at the sky at the right time of night, one may see a meteor descending from the sky. These meteors contain the rare mineral Moonstone. Where exactly these meteors came from, nobody knows, but the magical properties of Moonstone far excel anything else found in the world. Studies have shown that the meteors fall more and more often as the moon waxes full, then decreases again as it wanes back to new.

item.name: Essences / Essence Bag
item.desc: Essences are used both in crafting magical items, as well as reagents for spells. Elemental essences are dropped by their respective guardians, and all essences can also be crafted using the #5Essence Refiner#0.

subitem.name: Etherium
subitem.desc: This represents etherium, AM2's power, and will be shown as part of certain spell recipes. When this appears, ensure your crafting altar is connected to the right kind of Etherium type (check the book on the Lectern, and by color), and flip the lever on the crafting altar.

subitem.name: Essence Bag
subitem.desc: The essence bag can be crafted to allow additional storage when adventuring.

item.name: Runes
item.desc: Runes are the building blocks for spells. When combined with multiple other items in the right combination, a magical spell scroll can be created.

subitem.name: Rune Bag
subitem.desc: The Rune Bag can hold a few runes, helping to save inventory space. If you have runes in a rune bag, Keystones will be able to interact with the runes inside it to switch their currently selected combination.

item.name: Mage Armor
item.desc: A more advanced version of simple robes, mage armor allows for slightly more durability, recharge, and protection. Mage armor, due to the runes inlaid in it, has very high capability to be enchanted. It also can repair its condition using mana drawn from its wearer. When wearing a full suit of mage armor, your mana regen speed is increased and all spells are slightly more effective.

item.name: Battlemage Armor
item.desc: Granted only to mages who have proven themselves true masters, Battlemage Armor offers a good amount of protection. It has higher durability than Mage Armor, but has a slower repair rate and less enchantability, as well as giving lesser versions of the magical bonuses that mage armor does. Battlemage Armor can also be given XP which will unlock protective spells that will come to the aid of its wearer, draining some of the magic within the armor. The magic will then infuse back over time from your own mana pool.

item.name: Affinity Tomes
item.desc: Affinity tomes contain detailed reports and information gather by magi over the years pertaining to a specific affinitiy. With the exception of the General affinity tome, they will, when read, give you a 10% boost to that specific affinity, while simultaneously reducing your progress in all other affinities by 10%.

subitem.name: Affinity Tome: General
subitem.desc: The general affinity tome is special in that it can unlock a locked affinity state. It will reduce all affinity progression by 10% without boosting any of them.

item.name: Foci
item.desc: Foci are used inside specific Ars Magica machines to change the way they function.

subitem.name: Charge Focus
subitem.desc: Charge Foci are used to increase the rate at which Ars Magica machines charge. In #9Calefactors#0 and #9Arcane Reconstructors#0, they also increase the rate at which the machine performs its task.

subitem.name: Mana Focus
subitem.desc: Mana Foci are used to decrease costs of operation in Ars Magica machines.

subitem.name: Lesser Focus
subitem.desc: Lesser Foci are used in various AM2 machines, and instruct them to operate in different ways.

subitem.name: Standard Focus
subitem.desc: Standard Foci are used in various AM2 machines, and instruct them to operate in different ways.

subitem.name: Greater Focus
subitem.desc: Greater Foci are used in various AM2 machines, and instruct them to operate in different ways.

subitem.name: Item Focus
subitem.desc: Item foci are used in the #9Seer Stone#0, and instruct it to search for nearby items on the ground.

subitem.name: Player Focus
subitem.desc: Player foci are used in the #9Seer Stone#0, and instruct it to search for nearby players.

subitem.name: Monster Focus
subitem.desc: Monster foci are used in the #9Seer Stone#0, and instruct it to search for nearby mobs (Zombies, Skeletons, etc).

subitem.name: Creature Focus
subitem.desc: Creature foci are used in the #9Seer Stone#0, and instruct it to search for nearby critters (Sheep, Cows, etc).

item.name: Keystone
item.desc: Keystones are used to link Gateways to each other, as well as to restrict access to Ars Magica machines. The UI for these blocks will not open if you are not holding a keystone with the same rune combination.

item.name: Mana Cake
item.desc: Mana Cakes both restore hunger and give a boost to mana regeneration. Plus, it's cake!

item.name: Mana Potions
item.desc: Mana potions restore mana instantly when imbibed. You get an empty bottle back after drinking one. Mana potions can be bundled by combining 3 of the same type of potion with string. The bundle can be used 3 times and will also return the empty bottles. The final potion drank will also return the string.

subitem.name: Lesser Mana Potion
subitem.desc: The lesser mana potion is the magical equivalent to a cup of coffee: a short boost, but it won't get you through an entire day. One use will restore 100 mana.

subitem.name: Standard Mana Potion
subitem.desc: The standard mana potion gives a decently upgraded amount of mana from the lesser one for not much of a material cost. One use will restore 250 mana.

subitem.name: Greater Mana Potion
subitem.desc: The greater mana potion uses the power of #5vinteum#0 combined with a #9Awkward Potion#0 at a brewing stand to restore a good amount of mana. One use will restore 2000 mana. The crafting table recipe is temporary while I figure out the derpy brewing stand.

subitem.name: Epic Mana Potion
subitem.desc: The epic mana potion is created by combining #5arcane ash#0 with a #9Awkward Potion#0 at a brewing stand to restore 5000 mana per potion. The crafting table recipe is temporary while I figure out the derpy brewing stand.

subitem.name: Legendary Mana Potion
subitem.desc: The legendary mana potion is created by combining #5purified vinteum dust#0 with a #9Awkward Potion#0 at a brewing stand. One potion will restore a whopping 10000 mana! The crafting table recipe is temporary while I figure out the derpy brewing stand.

subitem.name: Infused Etherium Potion
subitem.desc: By taking a #5bucket of Liquid Etherium#0, a mage can combine it with #5chimerite#0 and #5tarma root#0 in order to create a potion to give a temporary boost to maximum mana. Unfortunately, the process is minimally efficient and much of the Liquid Etherium is lost along the way.

subitem.name: Mana Martini
subitem.desc: In honour of Mithion's final release of AM2, which happens to be #9version 007#0, you can now make a Mana Martini that, when drank, will give you a 25% reduction in burnout gained from casting spells.

item.name: Crystal Wrench
item.desc: The crystal wrench serves many purposes. It can be used to direct Etherium through your power network. To do this, #9right click first on the source of Etherium you want to use#0. This marks the source block. Then, #9right click on the destination while still holding the wrench#0. #5Note that there is no need to click on Etherium Conduits along the way - just click on the final block. The power system will attempt to pathfind through nearby Etherium Conduits automatically#0. If that fails for any reason, you will be notified. This will force a pairing, and ensures the Etherium goes where you want it to. !d If you #9sneak while right clicking on the source#0, the wrench's crystal will turn green. This means the crystal wrench is remembering the source block's location, and you can click on several destinations in a row without having to return to the source. Each destination right clicked on in this state will be paired (if possible) to the remembered source. !d You can also disconnect power nodes by #9Sneaking and right clicking#0 on a #5non-powered block#0. This will switch the wrench's mode from link to unlink. You can see the change when the crystal on the wrench turns red. To switch it back, simply repeat the sneak right click to change the crystal back to purple. If you have a stored location, it will need to be cleared first before the mode can be switched (which is also done by sneak right-clicking a non-powered block). !p The crystal wrench can also be used to show hidden particle emitters, and can copy their settings by right clicking when in unlink mode. The settings can then be pasted to another emitter by right clicking. Each time you "paste" settings, you will need to copy them again if you wish to paste to additional emitters.

item.name: Spell Parchment
item.desc: Any mage that wants to cast spells without the need of some sort of staff or wand needs something to write the spell down on. This has worked for thousands of years, and surprisingly nothing more effective has been invented yet.

item.name: Crystal Phylactery
item.desc: The crystal phylactery is a life-force capturing device. A magic user who has one of these in her inventory can trap small pieces of souls from slain foes. Once the phylactery is full, she can use it as a component for a spell to summon that very creature to do her bidding.

item.name: Magitech's Staff
item.desc: The magitech's staff is a modified version of a spell staff that is attuned to ambient mana. It can be used to sense the Etherium levels in powered blocks by right clicking the block with the staff in your hand. It gains additional functionality if you have the #9Magitech's Goggles#0 equipped. !d The Magitech's Staff can also be used to reclaim a #9Magic Broom#0. Simply right click the broom with the staff in your hand to reclaim it.

item.name: Spell Book
item.desc: The spell book is a useful item to have, allowing mages to organize their spells and save space at the same time. The spell book, when equipped, can be scrolled through either by pressing x/z (default), or by sneaking and rolling the mouse wheel. Spell books can be dyed a variety of different colors. They can also be #5enchanted#0 with some useful powers.

item.name: Magic Broom
item.desc: You have taken the magical properties of Arcane Ash and combined them with a broom. Why? You're not entirely sure. What you do know is that this broom loves to keep the area clean, picking up any loose items near it and putting them in it's assigned chest. To place the broom once you craft it, right click on a #5any block with an inventory#0 with the broom equipped. It won't work otherwise. Currently the broom will grab all loose items, though it will be configurable at a later time. !d The broom can be reclaimed by right clicking it with a #9Magitech's Staff#0 in your hand.

item.name: Nature's Scythe
item.desc: Taken from the guardian of nature itself, this scythe wields immense power. It can clear leaves and plants with astounding efficiency. It can be thrown like a boomerang by right clicking, though it costs 250 mana to do so. All plant clearing effects apply while thrown, and damage is increased.

item.name: Arcane Spellbook
item.desc: Imbued with unknowable enchantments by ancient mages, the arcane spell book #9increases the effectiveness of all spells cast from it#0. Damage is increased, and mana cost is lowered. Things like duration and radius are not modified.

item.name: Winter's Grasp
item.desc: Taken from the guardian of winter, this arm can be used as a blunt weapon. It retains its unearthly chill, and drastically slows and weakens all struck with it. For 250 mana, it can be thrown, and will pull back an entity to you if it is hit by the arm, applying a more powerful slow and weaken effect.

item.name: Air Sled
item.desc: The air sled allows you to take to the sky with ease. It is slightly faster than creative mode flight, but does not afford the same level of control.

item.name: Earth Armor
item.desc: The earth armor is the chest of the guardian of earth. It offers significant physical damage resistance for a single piece of armor. It adds a sizeable amount of damage (+4) and knockback to unarmed strikes (no item equipped).

item.name: Water Orbs
item.desc: The water orbs allow you to control water subconsciously. While wearing them (they are a leg slot item), you will not be pushed by flowing liquids. You will also have infinite breath while underwater.

item.name: Fire Antenna
item.desc: The fire antenna, when worn, grant full immunity to fire and lava.

item.name: Workbench Grid Upgrade
item.desc: You've figured out a way to make an upgrade for the Magician's workbench that makes the secondary grid a 3x3 instead of a 2x2. Simply craft it and right click a placed bench to apply it. Keep in mind, the modifications are rather fragile, and will break off if the workbench is destroyed and will have to be re-made.

item.name: Binding Catalyst
item.desc: Binding Catalysts are used by the #5Binding#0 shape to determine what type of tool or weapon will be bound.

subitem.name: Binding Catalyst: Bow
subitem.desc: This one isn't implemented yet - look for it soon!

item.name: Warding Candle
item.desc: Warding Candles, when held, are moving sources of light. They can also be #9attuned#0 to a specific block by #9sneaking and right clicking on the block while holding the candle#0. This will cause the candle flame to turn blue when within 15 blocks of the specified block, and red when within 5 blocks. A warding candle will burn for 15 minutes, but is put out when not equipped. !d Warding candles are also used in #5Rituals#0, and are placed down as part of the layout. A Warding Candle that has been attuned cannot be used in a ritual.

item.name: Flicker Jar
item.desc: Flicker Jars are used to catch flickers. Simply right click on the flicker and you will trap it inside the jar. Sounds simple, right? Have fun...

item.name: Ender Boots
item.desc: The Ender Boots are a rare drop from the #5Ender Guardian#0. When wearing these boots, #9sneaking and jumping will reverse gravity#0! This will only apply to you, and you will fall upwards. Normal falling damage applies. You cannot reverse gravity while airborne.

item.name: Lightning Charm
item.desc: The Lightning Charm is a rare drop from the #5Lightning Guardian#0. Sneaking and right clicking will toggle the item on and off. When on, its static electricity draws in nearby items automatically.

item.name: Life Ward
item.desc: The Life Ward is a rare drop from the #5Life Guardian#0. When in your action bar, you will slowly generate a shield around you that will absorb incoming damage. It will generate up to 20 additional temporary hit points. The hit points remain if the Ward is removed from your inventory, but will not replenish themselves without it.

item.name: Magitech's Goggles
item.desc: The Magitech's Goggles are a companion piece to the #9Magitech's Staff#0. When worn, you can sneak and right click powered blocks with a Magitech's Staff. You will then be able to see all of the incoming power types to the selected machine, and where they come from. The goggles will also allow you to see broken power links; where a power path was before, but something went wrong (for example, a conduit was broken). Broken power link blocks cannot be broken by hand, but they can be replaced by any block.

item.name: Flicker Focus
item.desc: Flicker foci are used to create livable conditions inside a #9Flicker Habitat#0 for Flickers. It will enable them to perform several tasks, each of which are detailed to the right.

subitem.name: Flicker Focus: Item Transport
subitem.desc: The air flickers contained within this crystal have been attuned to the movement of items. Placing this within a #9Flicker Habitat#0 will allow you to link it with #9Crystal Markers#0 to interact with inventories containing items. To link the habitat containing this foci with a #9Crystal Marker#0 simply right click on the #9Flicker Habitat#0 then right click on the #9Crystal Marker#0. This foci can be upgraded using additional #9Flicker Habitats#0 with flickers inside them. This foci can operate without access to Etherium however it is very slow. Adding power increases the speed and allows the foci to make use of attached upgrades. !d Arcane: !l Increases the number of items the flickers inside can move at one time. The first arcane flicker will increase the count to 32, each additional arcane flicker will add an additional 32 items to the air flickers carrying capacity !d Lightning: !l Lightning flickers will increase the speed at which the flickers move items. Additional lightning flickers after the first will still increase the speed but suffer from diminishing returns. Most Magitechs belive its a waste to go higher then three lightning flickers.

subitem.name: Flicker Focus: Interdiction
subitem.desc: Arcane and air flickers working together can create a wall around their habitat if they are provided enough Etherium to do so. By placing this focus in a #9Flicker Habitat#0 and providing it with Etherium a nearly invisible wall is created in a 6 block radius from the #9Flicker Habitat#0. Modifying this with an #9Ender Flicker Jar#0 will also cause the #9Containment#0 effect to apply. !d Placing #9Ice Flicker Upgrades#0 to this focus will increase the radius of the containment field by one per ice flicker added.

subitem.name: Flicker Focus: Containment
subitem.desc: Ender and air flickers working in tandem can create a wall surrounding their #9Flicker Habitat#0 provided they have been given the Etherium to do so. Placing this focus in a habitat and providing it with Etherium will create a nearly invisible wall in a 6 block radius from their #9Flicker Habitat#0 that non-player entities can not pass out of. Modifying this with an #9Arcane Flicker Jar#0 will also cause the #9Interdiction#0 effect to apply. !d Placing #9Ice Flicker Upgrades#0 to this focus will increase the radius of the containment field by one per ice flicker added.

subitem.name: Flicker Focus: Packed Earth
subitem.desc: Earth flickers when contained within this focus can flatten terrain in a 6 block radius around their #9Flicker Habitat#0 using materials stored in an inventory below their habitat. While these flickers can operate without access to Etherium they are much faster when they have access to a source of power.

subitem.name: Flicker Focus: Flat Lands
subitem.desc: The earth and ice flickers inside this focus will flatten a 6 block radius area surrounding their #9Flicker Habitat#0. They can operate without power but are much more effective when connected to a source of Etherium.

subitem.name: Flicker Focus: Progeny
subitem.desc: The life flickers inside this focus can use a source of Etherium to cause animals within 8 blocks to breed. This focus requires etherium of any kind for each operation. The default operation time is 2000 ticks (100 seconds), but this can be reduced by placing additional habitats adjacent to the original and placing lightning flicker jars in them. There isn't much point in adding more than 4, as the minimum is 600 ticks (30 seconds). Each upgrade multiplies the current duration by 0.75, so the effect is diminishing.

subitem.name: Flicker Focus: Butchery
subitem.desc: The flickers inside this focus are constantly at odds. The fire flicker seeks to consume the life around its self, while the life flicker seeks to defend it. The balance that is struck in this conflict is that all but two of every animal type with a 6 block radius around the #9Flicker Habitat#0 that contains this focus will eventually be killed. Provided that the fire flicker has access to a source of Etherium to do its grisly work.

subitem.name: Flicker Focus: Lunar Tides
subitem.desc: The three flickers inside this focus can use their combined power to pull moonstone meteors that would land within 128 blocks of their #9Flicker Habitat#0 to land within 8 blocks. However to accomplish this they need a trickle of Etherium to keep them alert and watching for meteors.

subitem.name: Flicker Focus: Light
subitem.desc: The fire and lightning flickers contained within can use the power of the sun stone used in the construction of their focus to light a 16 block radius around their #9Flicker Habitat#0.

subitem.name: Flicker Focus: Felled Oak
subitem.desc: The nature flicker contained within this focus will seek out trees within a 6 block radius around their #9Flicker Habitat#0, once they do the lightning flickers will fell the tree one block at a time. These flickers can operate without a source of power but they are much faster when they have a source of Etherium to fuel themselves. !d Lightning flickers can be used as augments to make the process faster as well. !d If a nature flicker augment is added, the flickers will also re-plant saplings from an adjacent chest.

subitem.name: Flicker Focus: Gentle Rains
subitem.desc: The water flicker contained within this focus will hydrate the terrain in a 6 block radius around it's #9Flicker Habitat#0.

subitem.name: Flicker Focus: Nature's Bounty
subitem.desc: The life, nature and water flickers contained within this focus will work together to help all plants within a 6 block radius grow faster. These hard working flickers will help all nearby plants with or without Etherium but providing them with a source of power will allow them to do their work faster. When powered, modifying this habitat with a #9Water Flicker Jar#0 will also cause the #9Gentle Rains#0 effect to apply.

subitem.name: Flicker Focus: Fishing
subitem.desc: The combination of Water and Nature flickers causes them to be able to find creatures that live in water. It does require power to maintain the search, however, as the flickers cover a great distance in a short time. If augmented with adjacent habitats containing lightning flickers, they are able to move even faster, causing them to naturally find fish more often. Doing so will increase the overall power use. !d The focus requires a 3x3 square of water below it that is also at least 2 blocks deep in order to function. It will output fish into an adjacent inventory if possible, or drop them as an item if no inventory is present. !d A redstone signal must be provided for the flickers to start working.

item.name: Wizard's Chalk
item.desc: Wizard's Chalk is used to create #9Rituals#0 by drawing the correct shapes on the ground.

item.name: Journal
item.desc: Journals can be used to #9record your experiences#0 for later use. These experiences can #9later be recovered by reading the journal#0.

item.name: Deficit Crystal
item.desc: Often noted as the antimatter of magic, Deficit represents a void in the fabric of reality. You've managed to create a refined, crystallized version of it. Crystals like these are often used in the unmaking of things.

item.name: Inscription Table Upgrades
item.desc: These upgrades improve the functionality of your #9Inscription Table#0, allowing you to make use of more shape groups.

structure.name: Obelisk
structure.desc: The Obelisk is somewhat of a magical furnace. It can generate Etherium by burning #5Vinteum Dust#0 or #5Liquid Etherium#0 out of a bucket. The Obelisk generates #5Neutral Etherium#0. !d The structure depicted here does not have to be built all at once; it can be built in sections. The #9Wizard's Chalk Circle#0 is a standalone upgrade that when completed, will increase the output of the Obelisk's burn capabilities. The #9Pillars#0 are another upgrade, and will further increase the output of the Obelisk. !d If space is a concern however, these upgrades are not required for the Obelisk to function.

structure.name: Black Aurem
structure.desc: A sinister construction, the Black Aurem slowly but invariably pulls living creatures from around it inward to its center. Upon reaching the middle, bolts of pure darkness lash out and tear the life force out of the creature. The Black Aurem generates #4Dark Etherium#0. Mobs killed by the Aurem drop neither XP nor loot. !d The Black Aurem is created by performing the #9Ritual of Corruption#0 on an #9Obelisk#0. Like the Obelisk, the Black Aurem can be upgraded by adding certain multiblock configurations around it. The first of these is the #5Wizard's Chalk Circle#0, and will increase the amount of power generated from each mob the Aurem consumes. The second upgrade is the #5Pillars#0, which will further increase the power generation. The pillars can also have specific #5cap upgrades#0, which modify the amount of benefit. !d Obsidian and Chimerite are on the same level, with Sunstone giving a large bonus to generation. !d Neither the chalk circle or the pillars are required for the Aurem to function.

structure.name: Celestial Prism
structure.desc: The Celestial Prism is a purified form of the Obelisk that generates #9Light Etherium#0. It generates this power slowly, but passively. It requires nothing more than daylight to generate its power. You will know it is generating when runes of power begin to swirl around the crystal. !d To create the Celestial Prism, perform the #9Ritual of Purification#0 on an #9Obelisk#0. Like the Obelisk, the Celestial Prism can be upgraded by adding certain multiblock configurations around it. The first of these is the #5Wizard's Chalk Circle#0, and will increase the amount of power generated by the prism. The second upgrade is the #5Pillars#0, which will further increase the rate at which power is generated. The pillars can also have specific #5cap upgrades#0, which modify the amount of benefit. !d The most noticable effect are the #9Moonstone Caps#0, which increase the power by a significant amount, but also switches the prism to charge at night instead of during the day.

structure.name: Gateway
structure.desc: Gateways are quite efficient at short range, but longer distances require significantly more Etherium. The maximum range for a Gateway has been tested to be roughly 12km, though an extreme amount of Etherium is required to traverse such a span. A keystone can be inserted into the Keystone Receptacle in order to lock the gateway to the keystone's rune combination. Only then by activating another gateway with a matching keystone can one arrive at the keyed gateway. If the key does not match or no keystone is held at all when the gate is activated, it will be as if the keyed gateway doesn't even exist. This method can be used to control where you will wind up in the gateway network.

structure.name: Crafting Altar
structure.desc: Harnessing the forces of creation, the crafting altar allows mages to work miracles of magic. This is where you will create all of your spells in Ars Magica. The structure is upgradeable by 2 main groups, the caps and the main material. Both groups individually increase the available power of the altar and allow it to make more powerful spells. The main blocks, in order of power, are as follows: !l Wood Planks (+1 Effect) !l Stone Brick (+1 Effect) !l Sandstone (+1 Effect) !l Bricks (+2 Effects) !l Witchwood (+2 Effects) !l Nether Bricks (+3 Effects) !l Nether Quartz (+3 Effects) !l !l For the caps (grand total of 5 in the structure), the progression is as follows: !l Glass (+1 Effect) !l Coal Blocks (+2 Effects) !l Redstone Blocks (+3 Effects) !l Iron Blocks (+4 Effects) !l Lapis Blocks (+5 Effects) !l Gold Blocks (+6 Effects) !l Diamond Blocks (+7 Effects) !l Emerald Blocks (+8 Effects) !l Moonstone Blocks (+9 Effects) !l Sunstone Blocks (+10 Effects) !l !l These stack cumulatively, so for example wood planks with glass caps would equal a maximum of 2 effects, whereas stone bricks with redstone caps would have a maximum of 4 effects in a spell. The maximum number of effects you can currently have on a spell is 13.

structure.name: Inlay Rings
structure.desc: Inlay Rings are created by putting inlay blocks into a 3x3 ring with an empty center block. All blocks must be on the same Y level, and must all be of the same type of inlay block. You will know it is working when runes begin to appear on the blocks.

ritual.name: Rituals
ritual.desc: Rituals are created using Wizard's Chalk and Warding Candles. Arranging them in the correct pattern can enable you to do some truly powerful magic. !d Rituals will usually require additional items to be thrown on the ground in order for the ritual to succeed. These items can be thrown anywhere on the ground inside the radius of the Wizard's Chalk. !d Once you have your ritual laid out, and your items thrown in, you will need to cast the proper spell in order to kick everything off. The reagents will depend on the spell being cast,and order does matter. For example, when throwing down runes to recall to a gateway using a ritual, the order of the runes will become the keystone combination. !d The spell must target the exact center block of the ritual, on the same y-level as the chalk and candles. This is usually a block placed in the center, or an entity standing in the middle. !d If it doesn't work, make sure you are in the middle of the chalk, that the layout is correct, and that you have the correct reagents for the correct ritual!

subitem.name: Ritual of Purification
subitem.desc: The ritual of Purification is used to purify an obelisk into a celestial prism.

subitem.name: Ritual of Corruption (Obelisk)
subitem.desc: The Ritual of Corruption is used to corrupt an Obelisk into a Black Aurem.

subitem.name: Ritual of Corruption (Monster Spawner)
subitem.desc: The Ritual of Corruption can be used to pick up a Monster Spawner to be used later. The ritual removes the spawning capabilities of the spawner, so they will need to be re-added to it somehow. Rift or Life Tap can be used as well, so each tree specialization can perform this. The reagents are the same for all three spell options.

subitem.name: Hourglass Ritual (Blind)
subitem.desc: The hourglass ritual can be used to extend a buff to a significantly longer duration. It adds 180 seconds plus an additional 180 seconds for each Buff Power modifier included in the same spell stage as the buff.
